title: Uncial 076
text:
Uncial 076 (in the <a href="Biblical%20manuscript%23Gregory%E2%80%93Aland">Gregory-Aland</a> numbering), α1008 (<a href="Biblical%20manuscript%23Von%20Soden">Soden</a>), is a Greek <a href="uncial">uncial</a> <a href="manuscript">manuscript</a> of the <a href="New%20Testament">New Testament</a>, dated <a href="Palaeography">palaeographically</a> to the 5th or 6th-century. Formerly it was labeled by יa.
Description.
Survived only one parchment leaf (17 cm by 15 cm). The codex is written in two columns per page, 23 lines per page, 9-10 letters per line. It contains a part of the <a href="Acts%20of%20the%20Apostles">Acts of the Apostles</a> (2:11-22) with some missing words or letters. It used breathings and accents. The <a href="nomina%20sacra">nomina sacra</a> are abbreviated. The Old Testament quotations are marked by inverted comma (>).
Text.
The Greek text of this <a href="codex">codex</a> is a representative of the <a href="Alexandrian%20text-type">Alexandrian text-type</a> with some alien readings. <a href="Kurt%20Aland">Aland</a> placed it in <a href="Categories%20of%20New%20Testament%20manuscripts%23Category%20II">Category II</a>. 
The most interesting readings occurs in 2:13 where fragment supports <a href="Codex%20Bezae">Codex Bezae</a> against all other manuscripts.
History.
Currently it is dated by the <a href="INTF">INTF</a> to the 5th or 6th century.
The manuscript once belonged to <a href="William%20Tyssen-Amherst%2C%201st%20Baron%20Amherst%20of%20Hackney">Lord Amherst</a> in <a href="Norfolk">Norfolk</a>. In 1908/1909 Lord Amherst sold his library.
The codex is located now in the <a href="The%20Morgan%20Library%20%26amp%3B%20Museum">Pierpont Morgan Library</a> (Pap. G. 8) at <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a>.
